pull.title: Add a check for free disk space at first startup.
pull.body: As mentioned in #15813, there is a check for available disk space at startup in bitcoin-qt. This PR adds it to bitcoind too, at least for the first startup.

events.body: If this is actually something we want to do, we should also include a flag that disables this check since there are situations where users may want to run `bitcoind` without expecting to complete a full sync, e.g. when benchmarking.

@promag I addressed the changes (renamed `bytes_needed` and check if height is <= 1 instead of 0), thank you for your review.
Edit: changed also the misleading comment in [validation.h](https://github.com/darosior/bitcoin/blob/9001b435ad1951e1280d8f76601c08a47bf792ab/src/validation.h#L185)
@jamesob could we make it an argument, like `-dontcheckdiskpace` ?

events.message: Add a check for free disk space at first startup + fix a wrong comment in validation.h

events.body: @MarcoFalke this caused a segfault with `-reindex`, I added a check for `fReindex`.
IMO this is too much hand-holding for a server.

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#15340](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/15340.html) (gui: Introduce bilingual GUI error messages by hebasto)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

comments.body: Doesn't look like `nPruneTarget` is in bytes.
I don't think this is the right check for first run. I think the best one is to check if data dir existed.

Why ?
data dir could exist without any block downloaded and it would be necessary to check for available disk space too.
Ok. But note that genesis is being loaded asynchronously.

So this comment should be fixed:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/56376f336548b53cf31e98a58dfb4db22cede6e5/src/validation.h#L186-L187

Maybe
```cpp
if (chainActive.Height() <= 1)
```
would be better then ?
May as well leave this check out of the locked section, as it has no need for the related info.
Thank you for the review. I tested outside of the lock and it makes bitcoind hanging forever on error.
